intro: Jacobaea verna, commonly known as common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a spreading, bushy habit. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Jacobaea verna is often found in dry meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it has a long history of use in traditional medicine and as a pest deterrent.
